text: [Music]
hey everybody Thomas Josip here and
today we're tackling a breakfast
conundrum a sunny-side up egg and I know
you've been asking about this so I'm
going to show you how to do it it's
really simple you just need to know a
few tricks along the way and you will
have successful sunny-side up eggs so I
have a small 8-inch nonstick skillet
here I'm gonna heat it over medium heat
medium low heat what you need is some
really great farm-fresh eggs the fresher
the eggs the better because the whites
will hold up nice and stiff and they
won't kind of melt out and give you a
wide egg so farm-fresh eggs are the best
I'm gonna take two teaspoons of unsalted
butter into the bottom of my nonstick
skillet and it's sizzling nicely and I'm
gonna crack my eggs into the skillet now
a little trick here you should always
crack your eggs on a flat surface as
opposed to the side of a pan because the
side of the pan pushes up the eggshell
into the egg and you're more likely to
get shell in your egg a little tip for
you so you don't want your pan to be too
hot otherwise it's gonna Brown the
bottom of your egg whites before the egg
whites in the center get a chance to
cook so a lower temperature is always
better especially when cooking eggs so
what you can do here is tilt the pan
slightly collect any of the butter and
spoon it over the top of the whites
which helps to cook the egg whites
evenly so there's a heat source coming
from the bottom and you're spooning the
hot butter over the top to cook it from
the top now you want to cook the egg
whites until they're nice and firm and
make sure that the egg yolks don't
overcook you want to keep them runny
that's the best part about a sunny-side
up egg so the egg whites look nice and
set I'm gonna just take a little paper
towel here so this process helps to
absorb any excess butter so you don't
end up with a pool of grease on your
plate
this looks great I'm gonna season the
eggs now with a little bit of salt if
you're a fan of pepper which I am a
little bit of pepper and slide these
right out onto your plate with a little
bit of toast some bacon would be
wonderful and there you have it
sunny-side up eggs
in that what a minute-and-a-half
perfectly done wipes and a nice runny
yolk enjoy
[Music]
[Music]
you
